text: Colin Liddell (1925–1997) was a Scottish footballer who played for Queen's Park, Greenock Morton, Heart of Midlothian, Rangers and Stirling Albion. Liddell played for Morton in the 1948 Scottish Cup Final. He was transferred to Heart of Midlothian for £10,000 in 1949, then moved to Rangers in 1951 in a swap for Eddie Rutherford. ==References== ==External links== * Category:1925 births Category:1997 deaths Category:Scottish footballers Category:Queen's Park F.C. players Category:Greenock Morton F.C. players Category:Heart of Midlothian F.C. players Category:Rangers F.C. players Category:Stirling Albion F.C. players Category:Association football wingers Category:People from Govan Category:Footballers from Glasgow Category:Scottish Football League players Category:Date of death missing Category:Place of death missing
title: Colin Liddell
